name: AriaLive
description: AriaLive is a React component and hook that helps make your web app more accessible by announcing dynamic changes to screen readers.

props.name: variant
props.doc: Can be `text` for text messages or `content` for whole application content. Defaults to `text`.

props.name: priority
props.doc: Priority of the announcement. Can be `low` or `high`. Defaults to `low`.

props.name: delay
props.doc: Delay in milliseconds before the announcement is made. Defaults to `1000`.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: If `true`, the announcement will not be made. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: atomic
props.doc: If `true`, assistive technologies will present the entire region as a whole. If `false`, only additions will be announced.

props.name: politeness
props.doc: The politeness setting for the announcement. Can be `polite` or `assertive`.

props.name: relevant
props.doc: A space-separated list of the types of changes that should be announced. Can be `additions`, `removals`, `text`, or `all`.

props.name: showAnnouncement
props.doc: Whether to show the children or not. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: children
props.doc: The content that will be announced to the user.
